title: South Africa are a suffocating boa constrictor who slowly squeezed the life out of Japan before eating them whole
text:
At the end the tears flowed liberally both on and off the pitch as Japan’s players took their final bows; just one of the customs we have grown to love about this team and this country.

Yu Tamura, the fly-half with the goatee which looks a bit like that funny haircut that Brazil's Ronaldo had at the 2002 World Cup, only transposed to his chin, limped around with a broken rib, sobbing. Kotaro Matsushima and Kenki Fukuoka, Japan’s twin “Ferraris on the wings”, as South Africa coach Rassie Erasmus described them in the press conference afterwards, smiled ruefully. They have become global superstars at this World Cup - Matsushima in particular would be a canny signing for a European outfit looking...
description: At the end the tears flowed liberally both on and off the pitch as Japan’s players took their final bows;
